page.title: 09Charnwood local History 2
page.content: {Bess Bagley}refers to Mrs Elizabeth Bagley,who lived in the house near Copt Oak at the time of the Charnwood Enclosure Award in 1829.{Copt Oak,}is a tiny village at the ancient centre of the forest.Here,under a great tree (the copest,or copt oak)the old Swanimote Court of Groby Manor met.The tree,which stood at the back of the present churchyard,blew down in 1855. It was reputedly 2000yrs old,20ft (6m) high and 24ft(7.5m) in circumference. Enclosure came late to Charnwood,with the Act in 1808 and the Award in 1829.Most of the roads date from this time.{Joe Moore's Lane}is named after a man who lived in the Maplewell Woods and who went to live in America. {Whitcroft's Lane}was named after John Whitcroft who lived near Copt Oak and was one of the last people to remember the unenclosed forest.
